docs.lead_paragraph: A growing number of groups are providing mental health care without clinics or doctors, relying instead on mobile nurses, cheap generic drugs and community support systems.

headline.main: In West Africa, a Mission to Save Minds

docs.abstract: Growing number of advocacy groups are treating people suffering from mental disorders in West Africa with combination of mobile nurses, generic drugs and community support; mental health services are virtually nonexistent in many areas of Africa and Asia (Series: Shackled Minds and Bodies).
docs.snippet: A growing number of groups are providing mental health care without clinics or doctors, relying instead on mobile nurses, cheap generic drugs and community support systems.

docs.lead_paragraph: California has adopted the toughest limits in the nation on the use of antibiotics in healthy livestock, barring their routine use to prevent illness or promote growth.

headline.main: California Adopts Strictest Limits on Livestock Antibiotics
headline.print_headline: California Adopts Strictest Limits on Livestock Antibiotics

docs.snippet: California has adopted the toughest limits in the nation on the use of antibiotics in healthy livestock, barring their routine use to prevent illness or promote growth.

docs.lead_paragraph: California Governor Jerry Brown on Saturday signed a bill that sets  the strictest government standards in the United States for the use of antibiotics in livestock production.

headline.main: California Adopts Tough Rules for Antibiotic Use in Farm Animals
headline.print_headline: California Adopts Tough Rules for Antibiotic Use in Farm Animals

docs.snippet: California Governor Jerry Brown on Saturday signed a bill that sets  the strictest government standards in the United States for the use of antibiotics in livestock production.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many public officials are concerned that the approval will change the way the drug is marketed and used, though the agency says it will lead to better information for doctors.

headline.main: F.D.A. Approval of OxyContin Use for Children Continues to Draw Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Approval of OxyContin Use for Children Continues to Draw Scrutiny

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration's August decision to approve painkiller OxyContin for use in some children continues to face criticism from politicians, including Hillary Rodham Clinton; some doctors say drug is necessary for some children, although they acknowledge concerns about painkiller addiction are warranted; advocates say new labeling offers important information like dosage recommendations for children.
docs.snippet: Many public officials are concerned that the approval will change the way the drug is marketed and used, though the agency says it will lead to better information for doctors.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. oncologists, aware that patients are paying more of the costs of expensive cancer drugs, are increasingly declining to prescribe medicines that have scant or no effect, even as a last resort.

headline.main: Insight-U.S. Cancer Doctors Drop Pricey Drugs With Little or No Effect
headline.print_headline: Insight-U.S. Cancer Doctors Drop Pricey Drugs With Little or No Effect

docs.snippet: U.S. oncologists, aware that patients are paying more of the costs of expensive cancer drugs, are increasingly declining to prescribe medicines that have scant or no effect, even as a last resort.
